description: Square array a(m,n) = binomial(max(m,n), min(m,n)) (m>=0, n>=0) read by antidiagonals.
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Square array equals A007318 + transpose(A007318) - I, where I denotes the infinite identity matrix. - _Peter Bala_, Aug 11 2015
mathematica: a[m_, n_] := If[m >= n, Binomial[m, n], Binomial[n, m]]; Table[a[m-n, n], {m, 0, 12}, {n, 0, m}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 10 2012 *)
author: _Fabian Rothelius_, Feb 05 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Feb 06 2001
